info.name: Capture the Flag
info.attribution:
Game room layout and game pieces, by LawDawg 96 and are released to the Public Domain through CC0. Field background based on original photo by sasha set available at https://unsplash.com/photos/GURzQwO8Li0 under the Unsplash License. Rock background available under the Pixabay License at https://pixabay.com/photos/volcanic-rock-background-template-3836723/. Piece icons from https://game-icons.net/ available as CC BY 3.0: - Flag by Lorc https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/flying-flag.html - Spy by Delapouite https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/spy.html - Bomb by Lorc https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/unlit-bomb.html - Rank 1 by Delapouite https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/star-formation.html - Rank 2 by Delapouite https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/star-medal.html - Rank 3 by Skoll https://game-icons.net/1x1/skoll/rank-3.html - Rank 4 by Skoll https://game-icons.net/1x1/skoll/rank-2.html - Rank 5 by Skoll https://game-icons.net/1x1/skoll/rank-1.html - Rank 6 by Delapouite https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/sergeant.html - Rank 7 by Delapouite https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/corporal.html - Rank 8 by Delapouite https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/private-first-class.html - Rank 9 by Delapouite https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/private.html

Library image generated using the Midjourney artificial intelligence image generator, https://www.midjourney.com/home/, using the following prompt: "soldiers with muskets waving blue flag oil on canvas --ar 1:1 --v 5.1 "
info.description: Strategically arrange movable army pieces, bombs, and flag on board. Attack and capture opponents pieces. First to capture opponent's flag wins.

elseRoutine: var numCheck = ${numCheck} / 1 //if either piece has a letter, the result will be 0

resolveNumberRoutine.note: If rank is equal, send both home

elseRoutine.note: If attacker is lower, send defender home
If defender is lower, send attacker home

resolveSpecialRoutine.note: If both are Spys, send both home. This does not check to see if attacker is B or F since they cannot move.

thenRoutine.note: If defender is a Spy, it goes home
If attacker is a Spy and defender is 1, the 1 goes home

elseRoutine.note: If attacker is a Spy, it goes home unless defender is 1

thenRoutine.note: If defender is a Bomb and attacker is 8, Bomb goes home.

elseRoutine.note: If defender is a Bomb and attacker is anything but 8, the attacker goes home.

Change turns only if playing and not if setting up.

coverblue0.css: background: blue; border-radius: 35%; border: 2px solid black; font-size:40px; text-align:center;color:blue;font-family:VTT-Symbols

coverred0.css: background: red; border-radius: 35%; border: 2px solid black; font-size:40px; text-align:center;color:red;font-family:VTT-Symbols

enterRoutine.note: Put the piece id into undo. This is only necessary because the undo routine needs the info to be in there twice because that is what happens on the board.

enterRoutine: var undoGrid = ${PROPERTY undoGrid OF undo} //put the grid id into undo

clickRoutine: var undoGrid = remove ${length} 2 //do it twice because leaveRoutine fires twice; may update this someday
undoPieceChangeRoutine: var undoGrid = ${PROPERTY undoGrid} //This whole routine just limits the number of undos to 50 to keep the array size manageable. But leaving eliminating this routine completely would probably not slow down the game even if the move count got high.

fields.text: You're about to reset the board. Are you sure?

start.text: Press when all pieces are set

showRankRoutine.note: Put a big cover over the entire screen. Without this, if players move during the 3 second wait, things can get out of whack.
Remove the visibility limitations for the covers on back attacker and defender
Put a glow around the attacker and defender.

millisecondsChangeRoutine.note: After 3 seconds, set the cover visibility for both attacker and defender back to normal, reset the timer, and move the big cover out of the way. Then set css back to normal

enterRoutine.note: Put the piece id into undo. This is only necessary because the undo routine needs the info to be in there twice because that is what happens on the board.

enterRoutine: var undoGrid = ${PROPERTY undoGrid OF undo} //put the grid id into undo
